node.statement: REFORMULATION. Using the Chain Rule (node 1.6), define vectors in R^n: u_k = H_p(lambda_{sigma(k)}), v_k = H_q(mu_{tau(k)}), h_k = H_r(nu_k), alpha_k = omega_1''(nu_k)/2, beta_k = omega_2''(nu_k)/2. The chain rule gives u = h + alpha, v = h + beta. Since sigma, tau are bijections, Phi_n(p) = ||u||^2, Phi_n(q) = ||v||^2, Phi_n(r) = ||h||^2. This is a direct translation of the chain rule output into vector notation; no new content beyond node 1.6.
